Trump continues to push the executive order idea he also says he expects lawmakers to work on closing immigration loopholes and securing our border in Montana's tightening Senate race the libertarian candidate is now endorsing the Republican challenger NPR's Kirk Siegler reports democratic Senator Jon tester is seen as having a slight lead in the race
Not clear how much of a difference this endorsement will make those the libertarian candidate had said he expected to get about three percent of the vote Republicans are helpful they can prevent Democrat Jon Tester from winning a third term in a state that went overwhelmingly for President Trump but Montana is famously unpredictable says former state
Says even in Montana there's now an urban rural divide this race could come down to whether Democrats turn out the vote and liberal college towns and on reservations Kirk Siegler NPR News Helena
One of eleven people killed in Saturday's synagogue shooting in Pittsburgh eighty seven year old Melvin wax was laid to rest today as Kathleen Davis reports from member station WBFO say he was someone who wore many hats and his community
November ... was a retired accountant who lives in the close knit heavily Jewish neighborhood at squirrels how he was known as a kind of man who attended services every weekend a friend joked finally to the press that lacks would fill in any role that service if someone was unable to attend except Cantor
More than forty cars joined the procession after the funeral and dead more services are scheduled throughout the week for NPR News I'm Kathleen Davis in Pittsburgh
Sign up window for the Affordable CARE Act subsidized health insurance opens tomorrow with some stabilization of premiums and more choice nationally the average premiums under the plan are going up but only by low single digit percentages next year a year ago wasn't clear whether former President Obama's signature healthier initiative would survive
Also after January first those who opt out of health insurance won't be penalized at tax time
On Wall street stocks gained ground the dollars up two hundred and forty one points the NASDAQ rose a hundred and forty four points this is NPR
Automaker General Motors says it's looking to offer buyouts to roughly Eighteen thousand which white collar workers in North America the automaker says it intends to offer the bias the salaried employees with more than twelve years of service
Gym so I was well reported profits or two and a half billion dollars in the third quarter that wants to make the change in its workforce while the economy is strong GM's not disclosing terms of the offer
To new research studies conclude women with cervical cancer are likely to live longer if they get abdominal surgery
Though surgeons often treat early cervical cancer by removing a woman's uterus using instruments that fit through small incision women tend to have fewer immediate complications from these types of surgeries
But two new studies and the New England Journal of medicine find that women who get this less invasive surgery are more likely to die in the following years in one study women who had minimally invasive surgery head of nine percent chance of death within four years women with abdominal surgery headache five percent chance of death
Some surgeons have already stopped doing minimally invasive surgery for cervical cancer based on early reports of these findings Richard Harris NPR News
San Francisco giants have announced the death of baseball hall of famer Willie McCovey ... nickname stretch where his six foot four inch height and long arms was a former first baseman in fearsome hitter with five hundred and Twenty one home runs in more than Fifteen hundred
R B eyes and twenty two major league seasons Willie McCovey was eighty years old I'm jak sphere NPR News in Washington
